meanings.definition: Consisting of equal amounts of two enantiomers
meanings.sent1: The racemic solution had both left-handed and right-handed molecules in equal proportions.
meanings.sent2: The chemist created a racemic mixture by combining the two enantiomers in equal quantities.
meanings.sent3: The racemic blend of flavors in the drink made it taste perfectly balanced.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were a racemic mix of excitement and nervousness before the big event.
meanings.sent5: The racemic nature of the crystal structure made it difficult to separate the enantiomers.

meanings.definition: A mixture containing equal amounts of two enantiomers
meanings.sent1: The scientist carefully measured the racemic to ensure equal parts of each enantiomer.
meanings.sent2: The racemic was used in the experiment to study the interactions between the two enantiomers.
meanings.sent3: The racemic in the lab accidentally got mixed up with another compound, causing a funny reaction.
meanings.sent4: The racemic of opinions in the group discussion led to a lively debate.
meanings.sent5: The racemic of colors in the painting created a harmonious blend that captivated viewers.
